title: 'Shark Tank' star Kevin O'Leary's wife no longer facing jail time in fatal boat crash
text:
USA TODAY

"Shark Tank" star Kevin O'Leary's wife, Linda, who was charged in September in connection with a fatal boat crash in Canada, is no longer facing jail time.

Linda O'Leary, 56, was charged with careless operation of a vessel over the August crash, which left two people dead.

In September, Ontario Provincial Police's media relations coordinator Carolle Dionne told the Associated Press that the maximum penalty Linda faced was 18 months imprisonment or a $1 million fine.

Now, prosecutors are changing the initial charge.

Nathalie Houle, media relations officer for the Public Prosecution Service of Canada, confirmed to USA TODAY Tuesday that "after careful review," the maximum penalty Linda faces is a $10,000 fine.

In September, Brian Greenspan, O’Leary’s lawyer, said it was regrettable and inappropriate that police decided to charge her with a “regulatory offense under the shipping act.”

“She has always been a cautious and experienced boater who came into collision with an unlit craft on a dark and moonless night,” he said. “The other boat was sitting in a dark spot on a lake, no cottage lights nearby, no moon.”
